content.description: A L-R traverse the spans all the difficult parts of the boulder.
content.location:
Start on the big undercling with a good right foothold. It ends up and around the corner to the right. Full beta below:

Off of the undercling go into right hand gaston Match feet then hands

Right hand to the sloper

Kick right foot out to the tiny dihedral

Match then right hand to low sidepull

Left foot tiny hold and right foot fall in good one

Get the smile and farther feet

Right hand to sloper under undercling

Get slightly higher feet then left foot to big one

Traverse right a little farther and then go up

The Winking Boulder is located N of the Wavy Boulder.

content.description: A very short problem with a lot of holds.
content.location:
Start on an undercling crimp with a good left foothold and go up.

The Winking Boulder is located N of the Wavy Boulder.

content.description: A slab problem to the right of the winking face with a bunch of mostly useless underclings.
content.location:
Start on the undercling crimps and good footholds and grab the right sloper under the undercling and the right-most part of the smile. Get higher holds and top out.

The Winking Boulder is located N of the Wavy Boulder.​​​​

content.description: Slab problem with cool holds that goes up the middle of the winking face.
content.location:
Start with the undercling crimp and decent footholds, go up to the smile, and then the eye before topping out.

The Winking Boulder is located N of the Wavy Boulder.

content.description: A slab problem left of the winking face with sidepull you can lieback.
content.location:
Start matched on the half-sidepull/half-undercling IIRC and go out to the big undercling. Go up, match the right sidepull edges, and get a heel on the start hold. Get higher holds and top out.

The Winking Boulder is located N of the Wavy Boulder.

content.description: Off of the low rail get a foot up and step up while grabbing the small edges. Grab the top and top out.
content.location: Start on the low rail and go straight up.

content.description: A short slab problem good for warming up.
content.location: Straight up the from downpull edge.

content.description: A short, easy, warm-up problem with good holds.
content.location: Follow the crack up the up the wall and top out.

content.description: A problem that's a good warm-up, easy, and on a cool feature.
content.location: Start on the lowest part of the flake and go up, using the flake mostly for feet.

content.description: A short double dyno to the top of the boulder.
content.location:
Start by pressing off the gaston crimp and thumb on the undercling. Get feet high enough to jump to the top. Bump to the farther jug rail and top out.

The Wavy Boulder is located ~50 ft. NE of the Warm-up Boulder.

content.description: A slopey, reachy, and slabby problem. Will probably be harder if you're under 5'10.
content.location: Start on the big undercling and the huge foothold. get the higher undercling and a higher right foot. Keep reaching farther through slopers and getting feet higher up until you can reach the jug.

content.description: A short slab problem with several edges for handholds.
content.location: Start on two sidepull edges and small footholds, then climb straight up.

content.description: A hand traverse that follows the slopey lip of the boulder to the left.
content.location:
Start by pressing off of the gaston crimp with feet on the big footholds. Grab the lip and traverse left to the top.

The Wavy Boulder is located ~50 ft. NE of the Warm-up Boulder.

content.description: A very short sit-start problem with big holds.
content.location:
Sit-start on the crimp rail, go up and then out to the arête and get higher holds to top out. The stand starts is around V1. The huge ledge at the start is off.

The boulder it's on is located a little bit NE of the Wavy Boulder.

content.description: A slopey problem that's short but a bit reachy.
content.location: Start on the sloper undercling and the good right foothold. Go up to some good slopers and reach farther to better holds and top out. The ledge at the start is off.
